summary: This is an email chain between defense attorney Bruce Barket and federal prosecutors regarding discovery requests in the case of Nicholas Tartaglione, who was Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate. The discussion centers on obtaining forensic reports from Tartaglione's contraband cellphone, inspecting evidence from a July 2019 incident in their shared cell, and requesting a hearing about missing surveillance video.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is the defense attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione in his criminal case.
Tartaglione and Epstein were cellmates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in July 2019.
Defense attorney and prosecutor corresponding about discovery requests and evidence procedures in the Tartaglione case.
Both appear to be federal prosecutors working on the same case, copied on the same discovery-related emails.

events.title: Incident in Tartaglione/Epstein Cell
events.description: An incident occurred in the shared cell of Nicholas Tartaglione and Jeffrey Epstein at MCC, involving a makeshift rope. Photographs were taken and included in a report.

keyFacts: Nicholas Tartaglione and Jeffrey Epstein were cellmates at MCC in July 2019.
There was an incident in their shared cell on July 23, 2019, involving a makeshift rope; photographs exist but cannot be taken by defense.
Tartaglione had a contraband cellphone; BOP created forensic reports of the phone and SIM card that defense wants to review.
Prosecutors state no handheld videos were used to film inside the cell on July 23, despite defense inquiries.
There are issues with surveillance video from outside the cell; defense is requesting a hearing on what happened to it.
